packs.subdomain: AWS IAM Policy Structure and Evaluation Logic

resources.title: Policy evaluation logic
resources.description: The official AWS documentation detailing how IAM policies are evaluated. It explains the logic for determining whether a request is allowed or denied, covering identity-based policies, resource-based policies, permissions boundaries, and explicit vs. implicit denies.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Policy Structure and Evaluation Logic

resources.title: IAM tutorial: Create and attach your first customer managed policy
resources.description: A step-by-step, hands-on tutorial from AWS that guides you through creating a custom IAM policy using the JSON editor and attaching it to an IAM identity. This is a practical introduction to policy creation.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Policy Structure and Evaluation Logic

resources.title: Deep Dive with Security: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
resources.description: A comprehensive, self-paced digital course on AWS Skill Builder that provides a deep dive into IAM. It covers best practices for using IAM policies, advanced concepts like identity federation, temporary credentials, and troubleshooting access issues.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Policy Structure and Evaluation Logic

resources.title: IAM JSON policy reference
resources.description: Official AWS reference guide for the elements that make up an IAM JSON policy, such as Version, Statement, Effect, Action, Resource, and Condition. It provides detailed syntax and examples for each element.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Policy Structure and Evaluation Logic

resources.title: AWS IAM: Policy Evaluation Logic — EXPLAINED
resources.description: A clear, well-structured article that breaks down the sequence of IAM policy evaluation. It covers the hierarchy from SCPs and resource-based policies to permissions boundaries and identity-based policies, explaining how decisions are made.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Policy Structure and Evaluation Logic

packs.subdomain: AWS IAM Roles, AssumeRole, and STS Temporary Credentials

resources.title: IAM roles
resources.description: The official and comprehensive AWS documentation on IAM roles. It explains what roles are, how they work with temporary credentials, common scenarios for using them, and how to create and manage them.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Roles, AssumeRole, and STS Temporary Credentials

resources.title: AssumeRole - AWS Security Token Service
resources.description: The official API reference for the AssumeRole action within the AWS Security Token Service (STS). This documentation details the request parameters, response elements, and required permissions for programmatically obtaining temporary security credentials.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Roles, AssumeRole, and STS Temporary Credentials

resources.title: Deep Dive with Security: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
resources.description: A self-paced digital course from AWS that provides a deep dive into IAM. It covers advanced concepts including identity federation, temporary credentials via AWS STS, session policies, and troubleshooting access issues.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Roles, AssumeRole, and STS Temporary Credentials

resources.title: Assume an IAM role using the AWS CLI
resources.description: A practical, step-by-step guide on how to create an IAM user and role, and then use the AWS CLI to assume that role. This tutorial covers creating the necessary policies and configuring the CLI to use the temporary credentials.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Roles, AssumeRole, and STS Temporary Credentials

resources.title: Create and Assume IAM Roles in AWS | Hands-on Lab Guide
resources.description: A video tutorial that walks through the process of creating IAM policies, roles, and users. It demonstrates how to assume a role to control access to specific resources, using a practical example of restricting access to S3 buckets.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Roles, AssumeRole, and STS Temporary Credentials

packs.subdomain: AWS IAM Privilege Escalation Primitives and Misconfigurations

resources.title: Permissions boundaries for IAM entities
resources.description: Official AWS documentation explaining what IAM permissions boundaries are, how they work, and how they can be used as an advanced feature to set the maximum permissions that an identity-based policy can grant to an IAM user or role, which is a key technique for preventing privilege escalation.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Privilege Escalation Primitives and Misconfigurations

resources.title: AWS IAM Privilege Escalation Labs
resources.description: A fully hands-on course composed of 15 learning labs and 2 challenge labs. It allows learners to exploit real-world IAM misconfigurations in provided AWS environments to understand and practice various privilege escalation techniques.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Privilege Escalation Primitives and Misconfigurations

resources.title: iam-vulnerable: A Vulnerable by Design AWS IAM Privilege Escalation Playground
resources.description: A GitHub repository that provides Terraform scripts to deploy over 250 intentionally vulnerable IAM resources into your own AWS account. This allows you to create a personal lab environment to learn, identify, and exploit common IAM privilege escalation paths.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Privilege Escalation Primitives and Misconfigurations

resources.title: AWS IAM Privilege Escalation – Methods and Mitigation
resources.description: A comprehensive blog post from a security research firm detailing 21 specific methods for escalating privileges in AWS through IAM misconfigurations. It explains the required permissions, the attack vector, and the potential impact for each method.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Privilege Escalation Primitives and Misconfigurations

resources.title: A Deep Dive into AWS IAM Privilege Escalation Attacks: Defenders' Edition
resources.description: A technical presentation by Roberto Rodriguez from a Black Hat conference. This video covers the fundamentals of IAM from an attacker's perspective, details the deployment of a research lab to simulate attacks, and analyzes adversary tradecraft for privilege escalation.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Privilege Escalation Primitives and Misconfigurations

packs.subdomain: AWS IAM Resource-Based Policies and Cross-Account Access

resources.title: IAM tutorial: Delegate access across AWS accounts using IAM roles
resources.description: An official AWS step-by-step tutorial on how to use IAM roles to delegate access to resources in different AWS accounts. This is a primary method for enabling cross-account access when services don't support resource-based policies directly.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Resource-Based Policies and Cross-Account Access

resources.title: IAM Immersion Day Hands-On Lab
resources.description: A comprehensive, hands-on lab from AWS that covers creating IAM policies, users, groups, and roles. A section of the lab specifically covers creating a role for cross-account access, allowing users to practice the concepts in a real AWS environment.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Resource-Based Policies and Cross-Account Access

resources.title: How do I access resources in another AWS account using AWS IAM?
resources.description: A short and clear video from the official AWS re:Post channel demonstrating how to configure IAM roles to allow users or roles from a separate AWS account to access resources. It provides a visual walkthrough of the console steps.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Resource-Based Policies and Cross-Account Access

resources.title: Cross-account policy evaluation logic
resources.description: This official documentation explains the logic of how IAM policies are evaluated when access is granted across AWS accounts. It details how both identity-based and resource-based policies interact to allow or deny access, which is crucial for troubleshooting and advanced configurations.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Resource-Based Policies and Cross-Account Access

resources.title: Four ways to grant cross-account access in AWS
resources.description: An AWS Security Blog post that details four different methods for granting cross-account access using resource-based policies, focusing on S3 bucket policies as an example. It explains the security implications and trade-offs of each method.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Resource-Based Policies and Cross-Account Access

packs.subdomain: AWS IAM Identity Federation and External Identity Providers

resources.title: Identity providers and federation
resources.description: This is the primary official AWS documentation hub for identity providers and federation. It explains the core concepts of federating users from external identity providers (IdPs) using standards like SAML 2.0 and OpenID Connect (OIDC), and links to detailed guides for creating and managing IdPs in AWS.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Identity Federation and External Identity Providers

resources.title: Deep Dive with Security: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
resources.description: A comprehensive, self-paced digital course from AWS that provides a deep dive into IAM. It covers advanced concepts including identity federation, temporary credentials with AWS STS, and using AWS IAM Identity Center (successor to AWS Single Sign-On). One of the course objectives is to 'Create an IAM identity provider'.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Identity Federation and External Identity Providers

resources.title: Integrate external AWS accounts into AWS IAM Identity Center for central access management with independent billing using SAML 2.0
resources.description: A detailed, step-by-step written tutorial that walks through a real-world scenario of setting up SAML 2.0 federation. It covers adding an external AWS account as an application in IAM Identity Center, creating the SAML provider in the external account, and configuring IAM roles and attribute mappings for single sign-on (SSO).
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Identity Federation and External Identity Providers

resources.title: External identity providers - AWS IAM Identity Center
resources.description: Official documentation specifically for connecting external identity providers (like Okta or Microsoft Entra ID) to AWS IAM Identity Center. It covers using SAML 2.0 and SCIM for federation and provides links to step-by-step tutorials for specific popular IdPs.
resources.source_subdomain: AWS IAM Identity Federation and External Identity Providers

packs.subdomain: Serverless Function Runtime and Permissions Model (AWS Lambda)

resources.title: AWS Lambda execution environment
resources.description: Official AWS documentation detailing the Lambda execution environment. It explains the lifecycle of the environment, the available runtimes, how Lambda freezes and unfreezes the environment, and the local file system.
resources.source_subdomain: Serverless Function Runtime and Permissions Model (AWS Lambda)

resources.title: Managing permissions in AWS Lambda
resources.description: Comprehensive official AWS documentation on the Lambda permissions model. It covers execution roles, which grant functions permission to access other AWS services, and resource-based policies, which grant other services and accounts permission to invoke your function.
resources.source_subdomain: Serverless Function Runtime and Permissions Model (AWS Lambda)

resources.title: AWS Lambda & Serverless - Developer Guide with Hands-on Labs
resources.description: A detailed, hands-on tutorial that walks through developing, deploying, and invoking an AWS Lambda function. It includes practical examples of creating the function code, packaging it, and using the AWS CLI to create the function along with the necessary execution role.
resources.source_subdomain: Serverless Function Runtime and Permissions Model (AWS Lambda)

resources.title: AWS Serverless Learning Plan
resources.description: A comprehensive learning plan from AWS that provides a structured path for learning serverless concepts and services. It includes modules on AWS Lambda Foundations and Architecting Serverless Applications, covering runtimes and permissions in depth.
resources.source_subdomain: Serverless Function Runtime and Permissions Model (AWS Lambda)

resources.title: AWS Serverless with AWS Lambda, API Gateway & EventBridge | Full Course for Beginners
resources.description: A beginner-friendly video course that covers core serverless services on AWS. It includes hands-on demonstrations of creating Lambda functions, understanding invocation models, and integrating with other services, which implicitly covers the permissions required.
resources.source_subdomain: Serverless Function Runtime and Permissions Model (AWS Lambda)

packs.subdomain: Container Orchestration Security Concepts (EKS Control Plane and Worker Nodes)

resources.title: Best Practices for Security - Amazon EKS
resources.description: Official and comprehensive guide from AWS covering security best practices for Amazon EKS. It details the shared responsibility model and provides guidance on IAM, pod security, network security, infrastructure security, and more, which is crucial for understanding control plane and worker node security concepts.
resources.source_subdomain: Container Orchestration Security Concepts (EKS Control Plane and Worker Nodes)

resources.title: Amazon EKS Security Immersion Day
resources.description: A deep-dive, hands-on workshop covering a wide range of EKS security features. It includes modules on authentication, authorization, cluster endpoint security, image scanning, runtime pod security, network policies, and secrets management, providing practical experience in securing EKS environments.
resources.source_subdomain: Container Orchestration Security Concepts (EKS Control Plane and Worker Nodes)

resources.title: Security | EKS Workshop
resources.description: A collection of self-paced tutorials that are part of a larger EKS workshop. This section focuses specifically on security, with modules on IAM Roles for Service Accounts (IRSA), managing secrets, Pod Security Standards, and policy management with Kyverno.
resources.source_subdomain: Container Orchestration Security Concepts (EKS Control Plane and Worker Nodes)

resources.title: Back to Basics: Patterns for Securing Amazon EKS Clusters
resources.description: A concise video from AWS that explores essential security patterns and best practices for hardening EKS clusters. It covers key areas like access control using RBAC and IAM, networking, encryption, auditing, and vulnerability management for worker nodes.
resources.source_subdomain: Container Orchestration Security Concepts (EKS Control Plane and Worker Nodes)

packs.subdomain: Container Task and Role Isolation in AWS ECS

resources.title: IAM roles for Amazon ECS tasks
resources.description: Official AWS documentation explaining how to use IAM roles to grant permissions to your Amazon ECS tasks. It covers the benefits of using task roles for security, auditability, and credential management, and distinguishes between the task role and the task execution role.
resources.source_subdomain: Container Task and Role Isolation in AWS ECS

resources.title: Deploy Applications on AWS Fargate (ECS Tutorial + Hands-On Project)
resources.description: A comprehensive, step-by-step video tutorial that walks through deploying a multi-tier application on AWS ECS with Fargate. The project covers creating an ECS cluster, task definitions, services, and configuring necessary components like IAM roles for task isolation and access to other AWS services like RDS and Secrets Manager.
resources.source_subdomain: Container Task and Role Isolation in AWS ECS

resources.title: Amazon ECS task and container security best practices
resources.description: This official best practices guide from AWS covers key security considerations for Amazon ECS. It details the principle of least privilege using IAM roles for tasks, network security, secret management, and runtime security to ensure task and container isolation.
resources.source_subdomain: Container Task and Role Isolation in AWS ECS

resources.title: Create IAM Role for Task - Deploying CI/CD with ECS Container
resources.description: A focused, step-by-step written tutorial that guides you through the process of creating a specific IAM role for an ECS task, enabling it to interact with other AWS services like S3. This is part of a larger CI/CD pipeline project.
resources.source_subdomain: Container Task and Role Isolation in AWS ECS

resources.title: Task Role vs Task Execution Role in Amazon ECS: A Closer Look at Container Security
resources.description: A clear, concise article that explains the critical difference between the ECS Task Role and the Task Execution Role. Understanding this distinction is fundamental to implementing proper permission boundaries and isolation for your containers.
resources.source_subdomain: Container Task and Role Isolation in AWS ECS

packs.subdomain: Serverless Event Sources and Invocation Models (Lambda Triggers)

resources.title: Invoking Lambda with events from other AWS services
resources.description: Official AWS documentation detailing the various AWS services that can invoke Lambda functions. It explains the different invocation models (synchronous, asynchronous) and how triggers work for each service.
resources.source_subdomain: Serverless Event Sources and Invocation Models (Lambda Triggers)

resources.title: The AWS Serverless Developer Experience
resources.description: An official, in-depth, hands-on workshop from AWS. It provides an immersive experience for building a complete serverless solution using the AWS Serverless Application Model (SAM), which heavily involves configuring and using various Lambda event sources like API Gateway and SQS.
resources.source_subdomain: Serverless Event Sources and Invocation Models (Lambda Triggers)

resources.title: Developing Serverless Solutions on AWS
resources.description: A comprehensive digital course from AWS that covers best practices for building serverless applications. A core objective is to apply event-driven best practices and build applications that account for service characteristics, including invocation model and event source payloads.
resources.source_subdomain: Serverless Event Sources and Invocation Models (Lambda Triggers)

resources.title: AWS Lambda Triggers: Complete Guide to Event Sources for Beginners
resources.description: A concise and clear video tutorial explaining what Lambda triggers are, the different invocation patterns (synchronous vs. asynchronous), and the difference between poll-based and push-based models. It covers common service triggers like API Gateway, S3, DynamoDB, and SQS.
resources.source_subdomain: Serverless Event Sources and Invocation Models (Lambda Triggers)

resources.title: How to Trigger AWS Lambda Using S3 and SQS Integration
resources.description: A practical, step-by-step written tutorial that guides you through building a common and robust serverless pattern: triggering a Lambda function from an S3 event via an SQS queue. This provides a focused, hands-on experience with a real-world use case.
resources.source_subdomain: Serverless Event Sources and Invocation Models (Lambda Triggers)

packs.subdomain: Container Image Structure and Registry Concepts for Cloud Runtimes

resources.title: OCI Image Format Specification
resources.description: The official specification from the Open Container Initiative (OCI) that defines the standard for container image formats. It details the structure of image manifests, filesystem layers, image configuration, and the image index, ensuring interoperability across different container runtimes and tools.
resources.source_subdomain: Container Image Structure and Registry Concepts for Cloud Runtimes

resources.title: About registries, repositories, and images
resources.description: Official documentation from Microsoft Azure that clearly defines the core concepts of a container registry, repositories, and container images. It explains the relationships between these components and how they are used within Azure Container Registry.
resources.source_subdomain: Container Image Structure and Registry Concepts for Cloud Runtimes

resources.title: Build and deploy container images in the cloud with Azure Container Registry Tasks
resources.description: A step-by-step, hands-on tutorial that guides you through using Azure CLI to build a container image in the cloud and push it to an Azure Container Registry. This is a practical exercise for understanding the image lifecycle in a cloud environment.
resources.source_subdomain: Container Image Structure and Registry Concepts for Cloud Runtimes

resources.title: Getting Started with Amazon ECR
resources.description: A free, self-paced digital course from AWS that introduces Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR). It covers the basics of what ECR is, its main features, and how to use it to store, manage, and deploy container images on AWS.
resources.source_subdomain: Container Image Structure and Registry Concepts for Cloud Runtimes

resources.title: Quickstart: Store Docker container images in Artifact Registry
resources.description: A hands-on quickstart guide from Google Cloud that walks through creating a Docker repository in Artifact Registry, configuring authentication, and then tagging and pushing a container image to the repository using the gcloud CLI.
resources.source_subdomain: Container Image Structure and Registry Concepts for Cloud Runtimes

packs.subdomain: Object Storage Core Concepts and Threat Model

resources.title: Security recommendations for Blob storage
resources.description: This official documentation from Microsoft provides a comprehensive set of security recommendations for Azure Blob Storage, covering data protection, identity and access management, networking, and logging. It serves as a checklist for identifying and mitigating potential threats.
resources.source_subdomain: Object Storage Core Concepts and Threat Model

resources.title: Threat Modelling Cloud Platform Services by Example: Google Cloud Storage
resources.description: A detailed, practical article demonstrating how to apply the STRIDE threat modeling methodology to a real-world service, Google Cloud Storage. It identifies potential threat actors, diagrams data flows, and enumerates specific threats and mitigations.
resources.source_subdomain: Object Storage Core Concepts and Threat Model

resources.title: Secure storage for Azure Files and Azure Blob Storage
resources.description: This learning path from Microsoft includes hands-on exercises to teach you how to securely store business data using Azure Blob Storage. It covers creating storage accounts, configuring encryption, managing network access with service endpoints, and using shared access signatures (SAS).
resources.source_subdomain: Object Storage Core Concepts and Threat Model

resources.title: Testing for Cloud Storage (WSTG-CLST-01)
resources.description: Part of the OWASP Web Security Testing Guide, this resource provides a practical, hands-on methodology for testing the security of cloud storage implementations. It details how to identify storage URLs and test for common misconfigurations like public access, using tools like AWS-CLI and curl.
resources.source_subdomain: Object Storage Core Concepts and Threat Model

resources.title: What is Object Storage?
resources.description: A foundational overview of object storage from AWS. It explains the core concepts, such as how data is stored as objects in buckets with metadata, contrasting it with file and block storage. It also covers the primary benefits and common use cases.
resources.source_subdomain: Object Storage Core Concepts and Threat Model

packs.subdomain: Bucket Policies and Public Access Controls in Object Storage

resources.title: Blocking public access to your Amazon S3 storage
resources.description: Official AWS documentation explaining the S3 Block Public Access feature. It details how the settings work at both the account and bucket level to override policies and permissions that might otherwise grant public access.
resources.source_subdomain: Bucket Policies and Public Access Controls in Object Storage

resources.title: Secure storage for Azure Files and Azure Blob Storage
resources.description: This learning path from Microsoft Learn covers how to securely store business data using Azure Blob Storage. It includes modules on configuring storage security features, including networking and identity-based access, and has hands-on exercises.
resources.source_subdomain: Bucket Policies and Public Access Controls in Object Storage

resources.title: Cloud Storage: Qwik Start - CLI/SDK
resources.description: A hands-on lab where you use the gsutil command-line tool to perform basic tasks in Google Cloud Storage. While not solely focused on public access, it covers setting access control lists (ACLs) to restrict access to your data.
resources.source_subdomain: Bucket Policies and Public Access Controls in Object Storage

resources.title: Use public access prevention
resources.description: Official Google Cloud documentation on how to use public access prevention to protect Cloud Storage buckets and objects from being accidentally exposed to the public. It covers enforcement on individual buckets or at the organization, folder, or project level.
resources.source_subdomain: Bucket Policies and Public Access Controls in Object Storage

resources.title: Amazon S3: Configuring Access Policies
resources.description: A short video from an AWS Solutions Architect explaining how to configure access policies for Amazon S3. It covers S3 Block Public Access settings and demonstrates how to enable them for individual buckets and entire AWS accounts.
resources.source_subdomain: Bucket Policies and Public Access Controls in Object Storage

packs.subdomain: Object-Level Permissions and ACL Abuse in Object Storage

resources.title: Access control list (ACL) overview
resources.description: Official AWS documentation explaining what Access Control Lists (ACLs) are in S3, how they work at the bucket and object level, and the permissions they can grant. It also introduces S3 Object Ownership, which is the modern recommended alternative to ACLs.
resources.source_subdomain: Object-Level Permissions and ACL Abuse in Object Storage

resources.title: Hacking misconfigured AWS S3 buckets: A complete guide
resources.description: A detailed, hands-on guide for security researchers and pentesters on how to identify and exploit common S3 bucket misconfigurations. It includes specific sections on testing for read and write permissions on Access Control Lists (ACLs) using AWS CLI commands.
resources.source_subdomain: Object-Level Permissions and ACL Abuse in Object Storage

resources.title: Practice Lab: Misconfigured Bucket
resources.description: This article includes a free, hands-on practice lab that demonstrates how to identify a misconfigured S3 bucket. The lab involves using the AWS CLI to retrieve the bucket's ACL, identify that it's accessible to any authenticated AWS user, and then list the objects to find a flag.
resources.source_subdomain: Object-Level Permissions and ACL Abuse in Object Storage

resources.title: Access control lists (ACLs)
resources.description: Official Google Cloud documentation detailing the use of Access Control Lists (ACLs) to manage access to buckets and objects. It explains the components of an ACL (permission and scope), when to use them, and the principle of least privilege.
resources.source_subdomain: Object-Level Permissions and ACL Abuse in Object Storage

resources.title: Access control lists (ACLs) in Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation on how ACLs function in Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2, which is built on Azure Blob Storage. It covers the two types of ACLs (access and default), the structure of an ACL entry, and how permissions are evaluated.
resources.source_subdomain: Object-Level Permissions and ACL Abuse in Object Storage

packs.subdomain: Pre-Signed URLs and Temporary Access Exposure in Object Storage

resources.title: Sharing objects with presigned URLs
resources.description: Official AWS documentation explaining what presigned URLs are in S3, their use cases, and how to generate them using the AWS SDKs, AWS CLI, and the AWS Management Console. It covers granting temporary access to private objects securely.
resources.source_subdomain: Pre-Signed URLs and Temporary Access Exposure in Object Storage

resources.title: Signed URLs Overview
resources.description: Official Google Cloud documentation detailing the concept and usage of signed URLs for Google Cloud Storage. It explains when to use them, how they work, and provides guidance on creating them programmatically.
resources.source_subdomain: Pre-Signed URLs and Temporary Access Exposure in Object Storage

resources.title: Grant limited access to Azure Storage resources using shared access signatures (SAS)
resources.description: Comprehensive official documentation from Microsoft Azure on Shared Access Signatures (SAS). It explains the different types of SAS, how they provide delegated access, and best practices for managing them to ensure security.
resources.source_subdomain: Pre-Signed URLs and Temporary Access Exposure in Object Storage

resources.title: Guided Lab: Creating an Amazon S3 Presigned URL
resources.description: A step-by-step, hands-on lab that walks you through the process of generating and testing a presigned URL for an object in an S3 bucket. This is a practical exercise for understanding how temporary access works.
resources.source_subdomain: Pre-Signed URLs and Temporary Access Exposure in Object Storage

resources.title: Generate a Presigned URL in S3 and Lambda - NodeJS Tutorial
resources.description: A concise video tutorial demonstrating how to programmatically generate pre-signed URLs for S3 GET and POST operations using AWS Lambda and Node.js. It explains the core concepts and provides code examples.
resources.source_subdomain: Pre-Signed URLs and Temporary Access Exposure in Object Storage

packs.subdomain: Data Exposure via Static Website Hosting and Directory Enumeration in Object Storage

resources.title: Tutorial: Configuring a static website on Amazon S3
resources.description: Official AWS documentation on hosting a static website. It is a step-by-step guide that importantly warns about the requirement to disable Block Public Access and recommends using Amazon CloudFront with Origin Access Control (OAC) for a secure configuration, which is the primary method to prevent direct bucket access and directory enumeration.
resources.source_subdomain: Data Exposure via Static Website Hosting and Directory Enumeration in Object Storage

resources.title: AWS S3 Enumeration Basics
resources.description: A hands-on lab walkthrough that demonstrates how to perform S3 bucket enumeration. It covers identifying S3 resources linked to a website, checking access configurations, and using the AWS CLI to list bucket contents when misconfigured, directly addressing the directory enumeration vulnerability.
resources.source_subdomain: Data Exposure via Static Website Hosting and Directory Enumeration in Object Storage

resources.title: Hacking misconfigured AWS S3 buckets: A complete guide
resources.description: A detailed guide for security researchers on how to find and test for common S3 bucket misconfigurations. It provides specific AWS CLI commands to test for list permissions, which is the core of directory enumeration, as well as read, write, and ACL permissions.
resources.source_subdomain: Data Exposure via Static Website Hosting and Directory Enumeration in Object Storage

resources.title: Securing GCS Buckets: disable directory listing!
resources.description: This article explains the risk of public directory listing in Google Cloud Storage. It contrasts the 'Storage Object Viewer' role, which allows listing, with the more restrictive 'Storage Legacy Object Reader' role to prevent it, providing a direct solution to the enumeration problem in GCS.
resources.source_subdomain: Data Exposure via Static Website Hosting and Directory Enumeration in Object Storage

resources.title: A05:2021 – Security Misconfiguration
resources.description: This OWASP Top 10 entry provides the foundational context for this vulnerability. It explicitly lists 'improperly configured permissions on cloud services' and 'publicly accessible cloud storage' as common examples of security misconfiguration, helping learners understand the broader category of the risk.
resources.source_subdomain: Data Exposure via Static Website Hosting and Directory Enumeration in Object Storage

packs.subdomain: Persistence and Lateral Movement Using Object Storage Features

resources.title: Inside the attack chain: Threat activity targeting Azure Blob Storage
resources.description: A detailed analysis from Microsoft's threat intelligence team on how attackers compromise Azure Blob Storage. It covers the entire attack chain, from initial access using leaked credentials to persistence and lateral movement by modifying container policies and leveraging trusted data pipelines.
resources.source_subdomain: Persistence and Lateral Movement Using Object Storage Features

resources.title: S3 Bucket Backdoor Attack Simulation with Stratus Red Team
resources.description: A hands-on lab that walks through using Stratus Red Team, an open-source tool, to simulate an attack on an S3 bucket. The lab demonstrates how to backdoor a bucket by applying a malicious bucket policy that grants an external AWS account access, a common persistence technique.
resources.source_subdomain: Persistence and Lateral Movement Using Object Storage Features

resources.title: Set and manage IAM policies on buckets
resources.description: Official Google Cloud documentation on applying IAM policies to Cloud Storage buckets. Understanding how legitimate permissions are structured is critical to recognizing how they can be subtly modified or abused by an attacker to create persistence or enable lateral movement.
resources.source_subdomain: Persistence and Lateral Movement Using Object Storage Features

resources.title: S3 File ACL Persistence
resources.description: A focused tutorial explaining how S3 Access Control Lists (ACLs) can be abused to create a persistence mechanism. It details how an attacker with s3:PutObjectAcl permissions can grant another AWS account they control access to specific objects, creating a backdoor that might evade detection focused on IAM policies.
resources.source_subdomain: Persistence and Lateral Movement Using Object Storage Features

packs.subdomain: Log Sources and Event Types in Cloud Environments

resources.title: Cloud Audit Logs overview
resources.description: Official Google Cloud documentation explaining the different types of audit logs: Admin Activity, Data Access, System Event, and Policy Denied. It describes what actions generate these logs and how to view them.
resources.source_subdomain: Log Sources and Event Types in Cloud Environments

resources.title: Azure Activity log event schema
resources.description: Detailed official documentation from Microsoft that breaks down the JSON schema for Azure Activity Log events. It covers the different categories of events, such as Administrative, Security, and Policy, which is critical for parsing and analysis in a SIEM.
resources.source_subdomain: Log Sources and Event Types in Cloud Environments

resources.title: Tutorial: Use Log Analytics to analyze logs in Azure Monitor
resources.description: A step-by-step, hands-on tutorial that guides users through the Log Analytics interface in Azure. It teaches how to write and run basic log queries using Kusto Query Language (KQL) to filter, sort, and visualize log data from Azure resources.
resources.source_subdomain: Log Sources and Event Types in Cloud Environments

resources.title: Collecting and Analyzing Logs with Amazon CloudWatch Logs Insights
resources.description: An official AWS Builder Lab that provides hands-on practice with Amazon CloudWatch Logs Insights. Participants learn to run queries to search and analyze log data from various AWS services, a key skill for incident investigation.
resources.source_subdomain: Log Sources and Event Types in Cloud Environments

resources.title: Understanding CloudTrail events
resources.description: Official AWS documentation defining what a CloudTrail event is and breaking down the different event types: Management events, Data events, and Insights events. This is fundamental for understanding the primary source of user and API activity logs in AWS.
resources.source_subdomain: Log Sources and Event Types in Cloud Environments

packs.subdomain: SIEM Data Normalization and Field Mapping

resources.title: Normalization and the Advanced Security Information Model (ASIM)
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation explaining the Advanced Security Information Model (ASIM) used in Microsoft Sentinel. It covers the architecture, components like schemas and parsers, and how ASIM provides a normalized view of data from various sources to enable source-agnostic content and analytics.
resources.source_subdomain: SIEM Data Normalization and Field Mapping

resources.title: Use the CIM to normalize data at search time
resources.description: This official Splunk documentation provides a step-by-step guide on how to normalize data to the Splunk Common Information Model (CIM). It covers examining data, configuring tags, making fields CIM-compliant, and validating the data against the data model.
resources.source_subdomain: SIEM Data Normalization and Field Mapping

resources.title: Splunk Field Extraction Walkthrough
resources.description: A video tutorial that demonstrates different methods for parsing and extracting fields from data in Splunk. It covers using the built-in field extractor utility and also delves into more advanced configurations using props.conf and transforms.conf for complex extractions.
resources.source_subdomain: SIEM Data Normalization and Field Mapping

resources.title: Data normalization in Microsoft Sentinel
resources.description: A free, hands-on learning module from Microsoft that teaches how to use the Advanced Security Information Model (ASIM) in Microsoft Sentinel. The course covers using and creating ASIM parsers and understanding parameterized KQL functions to normalize data.
resources.source_subdomain: SIEM Data Normalization and Field Mapping

resources.title: Elastic Common Schema (ECS) reference
resources.description: The official and comprehensive reference documentation for the Elastic Common Schema (ECS). It defines a common set of fields for storing event data in Elasticsearch, providing detailed field descriptions, data types, and usage guidelines to help normalize data from diverse sources.
resources.source_subdomain: SIEM Data Normalization and Field Mapping

packs.subdomain: Log Parsing and Enrichment for Security Analytics

resources.title: Normalization and the Advanced Security Information Model (ASIM)
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation explaining how Microsoft Sentinel uses the Advanced Security Information Model (ASIM) to normalize and enrich log data at both ingest time and query time. It covers the architecture, parsers, and schemas.
resources.source_subdomain: Log Parsing and Enrichment for Security Analytics

resources.title: How data moves through Splunk deployments: The data pipeline
resources.description: Official Splunk documentation detailing the data pipeline, which includes the parsing phase. This resource explains how Splunk software examines, analyzes, and transforms data, breaking it into individual events and extracting fields.
resources.source_subdomain: Log Parsing and Enrichment for Security Analytics

resources.title: Enrich your data
resources.description: Official Elastic documentation on how to use the enrich processor and ingest pipelines to add data from existing indices to incoming documents at ingest time. This is a core concept for enriching log data within the Elastic Stack for security analytics.
resources.source_subdomain: Log Parsing and Enrichment for Security Analytics

resources.title: How to parse network messages with KQL in Sentinel
resources.description: A detailed, hands-on tutorial that breaks down how to parse various network log formats (JSON, CEF, Syslog) using Kusto Query Language (KQL) in Microsoft Sentinel. It provides practical examples and explains the logic behind the queries.
resources.source_subdomain: Log Parsing and Enrichment for Security Analytics

resources.title: Log Analysis
resources.description: A hands-on learning module covering the fundamentals of log analysis. It includes practical exercises on collecting, parsing, processing, and correlating logs to identify security threats and anomalies, with a focus on using Splunk.
resources.source_subdomain: Log Parsing and Enrichment for Security Analytics

packs.subdomain: Detection Logic and SIEM Rule Design

resources.title: Tutorial: Detect threats by using analytics rules in Microsoft Sentinel
resources.description: A hands-on, step-by-step guide from Microsoft on how to create and customize scheduled analytics rules from templates to detect threats. It covers customizing query logic, enriching alerts with entity mapping, and configuring automated responses.
resources.source_subdomain: Detection Logic and SIEM Rule Design

resources.title: Create a correlation search
resources.description: This official Splunk tutorial walks users through the entire process of creating a correlation search in Splunk Enterprise Security. It is a multi-part guide covering planning the use case, creating the search using the wizard, scheduling, and choosing response actions.
resources.source_subdomain: Detection Logic and SIEM Rule Design

resources.title: Create a detection rule
resources.description: Official documentation from Elastic detailing the process of creating various types of detection rules (custom query, machine learning, threshold, etc.) within the Elastic Security SIEM. It provides requirements, step-by-step instructions, and configuration options.
resources.source_subdomain: Detection Logic and SIEM Rule Design

resources.title: Detection Engineering: A Comprehensive Guide
resources.description: A comprehensive guide that explains the core concepts and cyclical process of detection engineering. It covers the key elements, including threat detection, alert generation, and how to fine-tune security technologies to better detect malicious activity based on TTPs.
resources.source_subdomain: Detection Logic and SIEM Rule Design

packs.subdomain: Alert Tuning, Noise Reduction, and Signal Quality in SIEM

resources.title: Tune detection rules
resources.description: Official Elastic documentation on how to tune detection rules to improve signal quality. It covers disabling noisy rules, cloning and modifying rules to align with local policies, adjusting risk scores, and suppressing duplicate alerts. It also provides specific guidance for tuning rules related to processes, PowerShell, network activity, and indicator matches.
resources.source_subdomain: Alert Tuning, Noise Reduction, and Signal Quality in SIEM

resources.title: Stop Sentinel Alert Noise: A Practical Rule Tuning Guide
resources.description: A practical, step-by-step guide on reducing alert noise in Microsoft Sentinel. The tutorial covers two primary methods: using automation rules to auto-close known benign incidents and surgically refining the KQL query of an analytics rule to make it more specific and reduce false positives.
resources.source_subdomain: Alert Tuning, Noise Reduction, and Signal Quality in SIEM

resources.title: Workshop: Making all the rules: Rule tuning for SOC admins
resources.description: A hands-on workshop video from Sumo Logic that teaches SOC admins how to tune rules in Cloud SIEM. It covers creating exceptions to existing rules (rule tuning expressions), creating new custom rules for unique business needs, and creating custom insights to help analysts focus on important threats.
resources.source_subdomain: Alert Tuning, Noise Reduction, and Signal Quality in SIEM

resources.title: Alerting Best Practices: How to Create Good Detectors
resources.description: A Splunk best practices guide on creating effective and actionable alerts. It outlines key principles such as ensuring alerts signal a real emergency, are actionable, well-documented, built as code, and iterated upon. This resource helps build a foundational understanding of what makes a high-quality signal.
resources.source_subdomain: Alert Tuning, Noise Reduction, and Signal Quality in SIEM

resources.title: Get fine-tuning recommendations for your analytics rules in Microsoft Sentinel
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation detailing the built-in tuning recommendations for analytics rules in Microsoft Sentinel. It explains how Sentinel uses machine learning to analyze rule performance and provide actionable insights and recommendations to reduce false positives and improve detection quality.
resources.source_subdomain: Alert Tuning, Noise Reduction, and Signal Quality in SIEM
